textPlain:
Startup-minded Senior Front-End / Full-Stack Developer (React, Angular, NestJS, TypeScript) with 9+ years' experience at startups and enterprises in the EU and US (fin-tech, e-commerce, KYC, green-tech etc.). Looking for a long-term remote role. Comfortable working in cross-functional teams and have also built & launched AI-powered SaaS products solo.  Location: Prague, Czech Republic (EU) - open to EST hours
  Remote: yes, please
  Willing to relocate: no, but open to occasional office visits
  Technologies: TypeScript, React, Angular, Remix, Next.js, RxJS, NgRx, ScSS, Nx, NestJS, NativeScript, CI/CD, REST, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Jest, Figma. External APIs: Stripe, OpenAI, AssemblyAI, Deepl, Discord etc.
  Email: oletrn@gmail.com

Résumé/CV: https://www.linkedin.com/in/otyurin/

Location: Santa Cruz, CA - (Bay Area)Remote: Either/HybridWilling to relocate: YesCV: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1LhawaE3UFjF88UBxPYXnc4ti6vY...Email: surygeng812@gmail.comTechnologies: High-throughput data pipelines, Cloud computing, Machine learning, Neurotech, Python, C/C++, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, Bash, Qt, Redis, MQTT, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS (S3, EC2), Git, MATLAB, Electrophysiology, IoT systems, Time-series analysis, Containerized workflows, and Brain-computer interfaces.Bio:
I recently completed my PhD in Electrical and Computer Engineering at UC Santa Cruz, where I focused on data engineering, cloud computing, and IoT systems for high-throughput biological data. I build full-stack platforms for time-series data acquisition and cloud pipelines that handle terabytes of data per day per system. My recent work involved modeling complex biological signals using techniques like hidden Markov models and SVD, building longitudinal tracking algorithms, and running real-time experimental feedback systems. In one project, my cloud-based neurotechnology platform was used to remotely detect and stop seizure activity in live human brain tissue.I’ve built tools now used by multiple labs nationwide, published in Nature Neuroscience, and open-sourced several platforms including braingeneerspy, mission_control, and piphys. My contributions have supported multiple successful grant applications, helping our research group secure millions in funding from sources including the NSF, NIH, and private foundations.I’m looking for roles where I can keep solving hard problems at the interface of hardware, software, and data; particularly in bioengineering, neurotechnology, or scientific computing startups.I’m confident I can bring value to your team, whether in industry or research. Feel free to reach out if you'd like to connect.- Sury

Location: New York, NYRemote: Preference for in-office/hybrid, open to remoteWilling to relocate: noTechnologies: machine learning, LLMs, flow matching, JAX, PyTorch, PythonResume: https://www.echonolan.net/resume/cv.pdfEmail: echo@echonolan.netI'm an ML engineer/ML research engineer looking for roles where there are gradients to descend, models to build, and/or datasets to gather. In general I want to advance the frontier of what's possible. My credentials are more towards research engineering than applied work, but I'm open to both. My last job was as a contract research engineer doing AI safety work at Redwood Research. I spent about half my time on our synthetic datasets of safe & unsafe LLM behavior, and the other half on fancy finetuning. I finetuned an LLM to exhibit unsafe behavior while fooling logistic probes trained to detect it, but only in deployment. Weird multi-part composite loss. My other big project is independent research in text-to-image models that are trained solely on unlabeled image data, exploiting CLIP embeddings for the link between text and images. If nothing goes horribly wrong I'll be submitting a paper for ICLR in about 7 weeks.If you need help getting ML systems up and running, getting them fast and correct, or if any of that stuff sounds interesting to you, get in touch.

Location: Milpitas, CARemote: YesWilling to relocate: YesTechnologies: Java, Python, Spring Boot, AWS (ECS, Lambda), Kafka, PostgreSQL, ReactJS, TypeScript, Next.js, Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, REST, FastAPIRésumé/CV: https://www.linkedin.com/in/vidyavarshinihj/Email: hjvidyavarshini [at] gmail [dot] comSDE with 4+ years of industry experience building scalable backend services, event-driven architectures, and responsive front-end apps in cloud-native environments.Led migration from legacy .NET systems to microservices in Java 17, deployed on AWS ECS using Spring Boot and PostgreSQL, reducing latency by 50%.Designed and implemented real-time data pipelines using Kafka and FastAPI, and built fully containerized deployments with Docker and Terraform.Developed secure, FHIR-compliant APIs for healthcare systems, optimized CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins), and delivered resilient systems for 1000+ deployments.Built cloud-first apps with ReactJS + NodeJS, and worked on low-latency, highly available systems at scale (e.g., music streaming & transit analytics).Published deep RL research at ICLR 2025 and recently contributed to AI modeling using PyTorch + TensorFlow.Seeking backend or full-stack roles where I can architect reliable systems, optimize APIs, and ship scalable features in production.

Systems engineer with ten years of experience building performance critical software. The past couple of years I’ve been maintaining the most popular Go library for working with eBPF (used by DataDog, Microsoft, etc.) and have contributed to the Linux network stack, the Go standard library and other high profile open source projects. Before that I built Quicksilver (global distributed db) and Unimog (anycast L4 load balancer) at Cloudflare. In my spare time I’ve dabbled in embedded operating systems, virtual machine monitors and emulators.I’m self taught, learn by doing and enjoy going deep on a specific subject. After working as a fully remote open source maintainer I’m looking for a small team that values collaborating in person, in a strategic role owning a domain or problem space, with a view to leading a team.I’m curious about problems that require exceptional performance and / or reliability in areas like power infrastructure, renewable energy, operating AI models at scale, non-LLM AI, hardware.
